document.masterDocTitle: Staphylinidae (Insecta: Coleoptera) in Latin America: synopsis, annotated catalog, diversity and distribution

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Staphylinidae (Insecta: Coleoptera) in Latin America: synopsis, annotated catalog, diversity and distribution

bibRefCitation.author: Fenyes, A.
bibRefCitation.refString: Fenyes, A. (1910) A new staphylinid (Col.) genus from Arizona. Entomological News and Proceedings of the Entomological Section of the Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia, 21, 117 - 119.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Acamatoxenus
Mann, 1925: 76
[synonymized by
Jacobson et al. 1987: 317
]

subSubSection.paragraph:
1 species is included in this genus from Central America. Characters/Description: Fenyes 1920: 327 (characters); Seevers 1965: 207 (characters in key), 214 (characters);
Jacobson et al. 1987: 317
(characters); Jacobson & Kistner 1992: 131 (characters); Ashe 2002b: 126 (characters in key). Key:
Jacobson et al. 1987: 321
(species of the genus); Jacobson & Kistner 1992: 133 (species of the genus). Distribution. Central America: Mexico . Other regions: Nearctic.

subSubSection.paragraph: Only one species is known from and is restricted to Central America.

Key: Jacobson & Kistner 1992: 154 (species of the genus).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type species:
Neivaphilus watkinsi Jacobson & Kistner, 1992
2 species are known from and are restricted to Central America.

Only one species is known from and is restricted to South America.
